posts.raw_content:
A democracy and a republic are both forms of government in which power ultimately resides with the people, but they differ in structure and decision-making processes. A democracy, in its purest form, is a system where the people directly participate in decision-making, often through majority rule. This can lead to direct democracy, where citizens vote on laws and policies without intermediaries. In contrast, a republic is a representative form of government where the people elect officials to make decisions and create laws on their behalf. A key distinction is that a republic typically operates under a constitution or set of laws that protect individual rights from being overridden by the majority, ensuring that minority rights are preserved. The United States, for example, is a constitutional republic, meaning it follows a democratic process while being governed by a set framework that limits governmental power and protects individual liberties. Telling kids for decades we are a democracy is why every blue hair retard or judge throws a tantrum when they don't get their way.  It removed individual rights from the equation.  REPUBLIC.. anyone who calls it a democracy needs schooling.  It's similar but very different.  It is decades of conditioning to make our kids retarded and ready to be controlled.




Speech by Elias Varn, a Blacksmith Turned Activist

"I am no senator, no general, no noble with lands and titles. I am a blacksmith, a worker of steel and fire, a man who has spent his years shaping metal with my own hands. I have no wealth, no army, no seat in the grand halls of power. But I have my voice, and today, I raise it—not for myself, but for all of us who toil under the weight of rulers who change with the wind, of laws that shift like sand, of a government that listens only to the loudest, not the wisest."

"They call their way freedom. They call their ever-changing rule ‘the will of the people.’ But I ask you—whose will? The one that speaks with reason or the one that shouts the loudest? The one that builds or the one that tears down whatever came before? I have seen how their so-called ‘people’s rule’ works. One day, a man is chosen to lead, the next, he is cast aside because the crowd has changed its mind. One day, a law is passed to protect us, the next, it is discarded because it is no longer ‘popular.’ Is this the future we want? A future where stability is a dream, where every sunrise brings a new set of rulers, new laws, new commands, with no foundation beneath them?"

"But I tell you, there is another way. A Republic—one built not on shifting moods, but on laws that stand the test of time. A Republic where leaders are chosen not because they make the biggest promises, but because they have proven themselves worthy. A Republic where even the smallest voice is protected, where the rights of one are not sacrificed to please the many. Where wisdom, not impulse, guides us forward."

"I was not born to speak before great crowds. My hands are rough, my voice is not trained in the art of politics. But I know what it means to build something that lasts. And I ask you—what kind of future do you wish to forge? One shaped by skilled hands, with purpose and strength? Or one hammered wildly by those who do not know what they create, breaking what came before simply because they can?"
posts.author: JustTheNews
posts.title: We are a republic!
